alert.note: Alert for York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 8:19PM EDT until August 22 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central York County in southwestern Maine... * Until 1130 PM EDT. * At 819 PM EDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Biddeford, Alfred, Sanford, Saco, Kennebunk, Buxton, Hollis, Kennebunkport, Waterboro, and Wells. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 22 and 38. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
